content: Is there an exhaustive list of target families and target os's anywhere? Like in documentation, not just the compiler (though the latter would suffice for now).
And I think https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/rustc/platform-support.html is kept up to date but don't quote me on that
@Joshua Nelson That list doesn't exactly show families or os. It is up-to-date, though (it is checked in CI).
@Jacob Pratt The families are unix, windows, and wasm

The OS's are android cuda dragonfly emscripten espidf freebsd fuchsia haiku hermit horizon illumos ios l4re linux macos netbsd none openbsd psp redox solaris solid_asp3 tvos uefi unknown vxworks wasi windows
Try for target in $(rustc --print target-list); do rustc --target $target --print cfg | grep target_os; done | sort | uniq. Takes a while to run though.

target_os="android"
target_os="cuda"
target_os="dragonfly"
target_os="emscripten"
target_os="espidf"
target_os="freebsd"
target_os="fuchsia"
target_os="haiku"
target_os="hermit"
target_os="illumos"
target_os="ios"
target_os="l4re"
target_os="linux"
target_os="macos"
target_os="netbsd"
target_os="none"
target_os="openbsd"
target_os="psp"
target_os="redox"
target_os="solaris"
target_os="tvos"
target_os="uefi"
target_os="unknown"
target_os="vxworks"
target_os="wasi"
target_os="windows"
Was hoping that there were more target families, but worth asking. Thanks @bjorn3 for the list of target OS's.
